newsitem.title: UK: Union considers motion on Allied Domecq.
newsitem.headline: Union considers motion on Allied Domecq.

text.p: British trade union the GMB said it will consider today a conference motion criticising Allied Domecq Plc for its decision to stop giving its pensioners an annual Christmas hamper.

On May 1, the company told pensioners that after a review of costs it could no longer justify the expense of providing hampers to its 28,000 pensioners. The hampers cost the company about 50 pounds each or a total 1.0 million each year.

"Allied Domecq can easily afford to give the pensioners their hampers. Scrooge has broken with tradition and made a summer appearance. Allied should be ashamed of this decision and be prepared to change their minds," said Derek Hunter, GMB National secretary of the food and leisure section.
